intro: Euonymus sootepensis, commonly known as the Sootep euonymus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cercidiphyllaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically reddish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
